name: The Professionals Comedy Show - Toronto's Best Stand-Up Comedy
description:
Canada's top standup comics unite to deliver an evening of hilarity! Acts have been featured on: Just For Laughs, CBC, Sirius XM and more!

When amateur comedy isn't doing the job, it's time to call The Professionals. A line-up of Canada's most acclaimed comics come together to leave you in stitches! 

Featuring Hershawn Arora, Hannah Veldhoen and Tobi Solebo.

name: The Happenstancers: Always Darkest … Dawn Always

location.name: Temerty Theatre, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Performed by "Toronto's best young chamber musicians" (Bachtrack), this unique program charts a course across a single night, framing the emotional apotheosis within Arnold Schoenberg's Transfigured Night, and its depiction of the tension between and reconciliation of two lovers. 

Juxtaposing three settings of Josquin de Prez's Renaissance song Mille Regretz (1000 Regrets) with contemporary chamber works, we begin precisely at sunset in Toronto and reimagining each work as a time and corresponding emotional state over the course of the night, concluding with dawn and the lovers' renewal.

name: Jonathan Nvita
description:
Born in Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of Congo, Jonathan Nvita is a versatile vocalist, composer, and multi-instrumentalist whose artistry bridges African musical heritage and contemporary jazz. 

His musical journey began at the age of five under the influence of his late father, a respected choir conductor and guitar player. Following his father's passing, Jonathan pursued academics in chemistry and biology while continuing to develop his music. He later earned a bachelor's degree in music from Humber College in Canada. 

Based in Toronto, he performs internationally, blending jazz harmony with African rhythm, song, and storytelling.

name: Kristin Lindell
description:
Infusing folk, jazz and blues into her vivid songs, telling stories of connection. Her shimmering vocals and uplifting sound is matched by her talented band with Jesse Whiteley on keys. 

Their latest project, River of Light contains nine songs about water, inviting listeners to explore vulnerability and creativity through the metaphors of rivers, ravens and shifting sands. Kristin has performed at festivals and venues across Canada.
